title: Probability
text: The first step is calculating the probability of flipping a spades in one turn. To calculate the probability, we divide the number of cards with the desired outcome by the total number of possible outcomes.

title: Possible Outcomes
text: How many total cards are there in the deck?

title: Desired Outcome
text: How many cards have spades? This is the number of cards with the desired outcome.

title: $$2$$ In A Row
text: To calculate the probability that $$2$$ cards in a row are both spades, we can multiply the individual probabilities together since we need to flip a card with spades AND another card with spades. The AND keyword hints at the idea that the probabilities need to be multiplied together. Essentially, we would multiply the probability of flipping a spade with itself.
